quest.name: Sworn Enemies of the Sun
journal: Magnai has a new task in mind for you and yours.

You and your companions continue to enjoy the hospitality of the Oronir and their leader, the most radiant brother Magnai. As prisoners of the tribe, you have been coerced into performing menial tasks as expressions of tribute. Lord Hien, for his part, has treated the whole affair as an opportunity to learn more about your rivals in the Naadam. Alas, it seems he and Lyse will not be allowed to take part in your next duty─to reconnoiter the encampment of the Dotharl.

To encroach upon the territory of so infamous a tribe without first taking their measure would seem exceedingly unwise. Happily, if Gosetsu's map is to be believed, there is a colossal wreck to the south of the Dawn Throne from which the two of you should be able to survey Dotharl Khaa at a safe distance.
You observe two hunters beset by massive beasts. One falls before you can act, but the other may yet be saved...

You reach the embattled Xaela and slay the beasts in time to save his life. Alas, as you suspected, it is too late for his comrade. Moments later, you are confronted by Sadu, khatun of the Dotharl, who spares but a moment for her fallen kinsman before demanding to know who you are. She can barely contain her disdain when she learns you are friends of the Mol, though she affords you some token respect after you tell her of your intent to fight in the Naadam. For saving her fellow tribesman's life, she grants you leave to enter Dotharl Khaa, and then turns to leave─but not before telling the still-bleeding hunter to see to his comrade's corpse.

Though he recognizes Sadu as a woman not to be crossed, Gosetsu cannot contain his anger at the callous disregard she showed her own dead. Never one to bite his tongue, he seems intent on going after the khatun and giving her a piece of his mind.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: You're back. They had me milking sheep, by the way. It was, um, interesting...

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: Another “task” completed, eh? I wonder what the most radiant brother has in store for us next.

dialogue.name: GOSETSU
dialogue.text: At a glance, their arms and armor may seem crude compared to those of Doma, but they are well crafted, and no less effective.

dialogue.name: MAGNAI
dialogue.text: ...A pity you will not pledge yourselves to the Sun. You might have proved useful in the coming Naadam.

dialogue.name: MAGNAI
dialogue.text: Nevertheless, I will permit you to return and fight for the Mol. Their cause is futile, with or without your assistance. However, you must first complete a final task, as was my decree.

dialogue.name: MAGNAI
dialogue.text: You will reconnoiter the encampment of the Dotharl.

dialogue.name: MAGNAI
dialogue.text: For this task, two will go, and two will remain.

dialogue.name: MAGNAI
dialogue.text: Should the two who embark upon this expedition choose to flee, or be captured or killed by the Dotharl, then the others will be taken as slaves and serve the Sun unto death.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: We'd better not fail then, eh? The question is, who should we send?

dialogue.name: MAGNAI
dialogue.text: That is not for you to decide.

dialogue.name: MAGNAI
dialogue.text: All of you have conquered Bardam's Mettle and proven yourselves warriors of the Steppe. You should all be equally capable of carrying out this task, and therefore, you should have no objections.

dialogue.name: MAGNAI
dialogue.text: The first choice of hostage shall be mine─though it is hardly a choice, given the circumstances.

dialogue.name: MAGNAI
dialogue.text: The red woman will remain. Doubtless you are not the moon I seek, but stranger tales have been told─and the men are of no use to me.

dialogue.name: MAGNAI
dialogue.text: You may have your pick of the men.

dialogue.name: DAIDUKUL
dialogue.text: Hmm... Yes...yes...

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Me, me! Pick meee!

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: What are you looking at?

dialogue.name: DAIDUKUL
dialogue.text: The firewalker! Yes, this Doman is my choice.

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: Hah hah! I don't know whether to be flattered or insulted. Mayhap both.

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: I had hoped to see these undying ones for myself, but it seems it was not meant to be.

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: I know you will be fine, but permit me to wish you luck all the same.

dialogue.name: GOSETSU
dialogue.text: We will return soon, my lord. But, if the kami are unkind, and we fail in our mission, then do what you must to survive. For Doma.

dialogue.name: DAIDUKUL
dialogue.text: Brother Magnai. A word.

dialogue.name: DAIDUKUL
dialogue.text: The Buduga require that a hostage be male, for if these ones fail, we cannot accept a woman as a slave.

dialogue.name: DAIDUKUL
dialogue.text: Therefore, we choose the firewalker. The one they call Hien.

dialogue.name: MAGNAI
dialogue.text: ...So be it. I shall choose second.

dialogue.name: MAGNAI
dialogue.text: I doubt either of you are the moon I seek, but stranger tales have been told─and men are of no use to me...

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: I don't know what this “moon” stuff is that he's going on about, but I don't like the sound of it. At all.

dialogue.name: MAGNAI
dialogue.text: ...No, of course not. The woman I seek is of the dusk─a gentle, ethereal maiden. A dancer in the morning mist.

dialogue.name: MAGNAI
dialogue.text: You are warriors of the Steppe─fierce and brutal, conquerors of magicked stone and steel. Ethereal you are not.

dialogue.name: Q2
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: I'm your rolanberry.

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: You try ethereally chasing after lambs, when your boots are full of lake water.

dialogue.name: MAGNAI
dialogue.text: ...A Western expression, I presume. Betokening...I care not what.

dialogue.name: MAGNAI
dialogue.text: Ah...how well your tasks befitted you both.

dialogue.name: MAGNAI
dialogue.text: But since I must choose, I choose you. You did well milking the sheep─they took a liking to you, I am told.

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: Gosetsu and Forename, then. I had hoped to see these undying ones for myself, but it seems it was not meant to be.

dialogue.name: MAGNAI
dialogue.text: Dotharl Khaa lies far to the south, where the grass turns to sand.

dialogue.name: MAGNAI
dialogue.text: Return with valuable knowledge, and all will be free to rejoin the Mol. Now go.

dialogue.name: GOSETSU
dialogue.text: Have no fear, my friend. We shall see them freed soon enough. Let us quit this place and speak of our plans outside.

dialogue.name: MAGNAI
dialogue.text: Journey south to Dotharl Khaa and return with knowledge. Do this, and your comrades shall walk free.

dialogue.name: MAGNAI
dialogue.text: ...You wonder why I chose her instead of you?

dialogue.name: MAGNAI
dialogue.text: There is a violence in you both. Hers is untamed. Yours is honed. She cannot be trusted.

dialogue.name: DAIDUKUL
dialogue.text: I will not mourn your death. Rather, I will celebrate it.

dialogue.name: BAATU
dialogue.text: Perhaps you think they were chosen because they are more valuable to us as slaves? You would not be wrong. Regardless, you are free. Be glad of it.

dialogue.name: GOSETSU
dialogue.text: 'Tis plain they hope we will never return. I shall enjoy disappointing them.

dialogue.name: GOSETSU
dialogue.text: According to my map, there is a colossal wreck to the south which should provide a vantage point from which to survey Dotharl Khaa from afar. Let us go and do just that.

dialogue.name: GOSETSU
dialogue.text: I spy tents to the west─theirs, I presume. What do you see?

dialogue.name: GOSETSU
dialogue.text: Over there, look! Those men are in danger!

dialogue.name: GOSETSU
dialogue.text: Gah! Too late for the one, perhaps, but there is yet time to save the other.

dialogue.name: GOSETSU
dialogue.text: Come! We cannot abandon him to his fate!

dialogue.name: GOSETSU
dialogue.text: These ones are mine! Go! Help the man!

dialogue.name: DOTHARL02511
dialogue.text: <cough> <wheeze> I...I owe you my life.

dialogue.name: GOSETSU
dialogue.text: Nay, friend, think nothing of it. I but wish we had come sooner...

dialogue.name: GOSETSU
dialogue.text: I knew at once he was dead. It will come as scant comfort, I fear, but I slew the beasts responsible.

dialogue.name: DOTHARL02511
dialogue.text: Nay... That is no way for a Dotharl to die.

dialogue.name: SADU
dialogue.text: (-???-)What is this? Who are these outsiders?

dialogue.name: DOTHARL02511
dialogue.text: Sadu Khatun! Forgive me. We were returning from our hunt when we were caught unawares by manzasiri.

dialogue.name: DOTHARL02511
dialogue.text: These ones saved me, but Geser is...

dialogue.name: SADU
dialogue.text: Who are you? Why have you come? Not to cross the sands, that much is certain.

dialogue.name: SADU
dialogue.text: I have heard tales of travelers in league with another tribe. Are you they? Who do you serve? Answer me.

dialogue.name: GOSETSU
dialogue.text: If I may begin to answer your questions before you ask more...we are friends of the Mol, and we are come to see the strength of the Dotharl for ourselves.

dialogue.name: SADU
dialogue.text: The Mol? The little lambs who wander to and fro at the behest of their gods?

dialogue.name: SADU
dialogue.text: Bwahahaha! What fools you are to share the soil of such weaklings! Next you will tell me you wish to fight in the Naadam!

dialogue.name: SADU
dialogue.text: Ah...so you do. Hah! That is unexpected...yet not unwelcome.

dialogue.name: SADU
dialogue.text:
I am Sadu. Khatun of the Dotharl.
For your deeds, I grant you leave to walk among us. Come. Look on our glory and despair.

dialogue.name: SADU
dialogue.text: We fear no tribe─least of all the Mol. Though, if you were of the Oronir, I would burn the flesh from your bones here and now.

dialogue.name: SADU
dialogue.text: You can stand, yes? See to the corpse.

dialogue.name: DOTHARL02511
dialogue.text: Y-Yes, Khatun!

dialogue.name: DOTHARL02511
dialogue.text: Thank you again, but I shall manage on my own.

dialogue.name: GOSETSU
dialogue.text: So that is the leader of the Dotharl. Clearly not a woman to be crossed.

dialogue.name: GOSETSU
dialogue.text: But how callously she spoke of her dead! “See to the corpse”? Surely this warrior deserves better than that...
